result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel A Mendoza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel A Mendoza is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel A Mendoza was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment to the extent it does not interfere with Social Security benefits.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including Domestic Violence counseling. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel A Mendoza

def does not plan to seek postconviction relief
Sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 10:30 am.
from DOC. Deft IS eligible for SAP

Defendant Daniel A Mendoza in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that deft's child had emergency surgery and asks for an adj

BTC: matter to be adj  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Daniel A Mendoza in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Upon plea to Ct 2 as charge, Ct 1 is dismissed w/o prej. The State recommends w/held sent-probation; conditional jail-ss as to amount and the State agrees not to file BJ charges due to dirty ZCI test but asks that said test be taken into consideration at sentencing.
P-G
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting with his attorney.  No contact with the victims, OG and NBM (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 05-05-2015; DEFENDANT MAY ATTEND ALL MEDICAL AND/OR HEALTH APPOINTMENTS WITH ANY PHYSICIAN OR PHYSICIAN'S ASSISTANT.

AMENDED 08-10-2015 - GPS MAY BE REMOVED. DEFT TO BE TESTED AFTER EACH COURT APPEARANCE AS WELL AS AT RANDOM

Defendant Daniel A Mendoza in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense asks that the Court remove GPS due to financial strain on deft. The State indicates they are intending to dismiss Ct 1. The State ss as to issue of bond understanding deft is aware of his obligations while on bond

BTC: GPS may be removed. Deft must be tested after court proceeding and randomly as well
